title: Art Tagging Guide
content:
[[module CSS]]
.art-container {
    display: flex;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    align-content: center;
    justify-content: space-around;
    align-self: flex-end
    gap: 1rem 1rem;
}
.art-container .art {
    flex: 0 1 200px;
    text-align: center;
    padding-bottom: 1rem;
    padding-left: 1rem;
    padding-right: 1rem;
}

.art-container .art .image-container {
    padding: 0;
    min-height: 100%;
    max-width: 100%;
}
[[/module]]

[[f>toc]]

The following guide is intended as a resource for both Artists and the [https://05command.wikidot.com/maintenance-and-ancillary-staff-team-main MAST Tagging Team], to help you know which tags apply to pages featuring artwork. Since a description can only go so far, we've added three example images for every tag, and tried to showcase a wide range of different artists. Refer to the [[[How to Post Your Art to the SCP Wiki]]] guide for a more comprehensive overview of creating an art page - this will just explain tagging.

This guide is focused on the tags that have been created specifically for artist and artwork pages,  although there is also information about the [/system:page-tags/tag/illustrated illustrated] rag, for original artwork posted on other pages. [https://05command.wikidot.com/tech-hub-tag-list Other tags] may also be applicable to art pages, particularly the tags for Groups and Characters. If a page features art that prominently depicts a specific [[[groups-of-interest | Group of Interest]]], [[[departments | Foundation Department]]] or [[[personnel-and-character-dossier | Character]]], that tag can also be applied to the page. If the artwork depicts events from a [[[canon-hub | specific canon]]] or is set in a [[[locations-of-interest | fictional location]]], Canon or Location tags may also be applicable. **[[[A Laymen's Guide to Tagging]]]** provides more information about applying these more general tags. While the intention was for art tags to be easy for artists to apply to their own work, please leave this to the tagging team if you're uncertain.

New art tags can be proposed in the Tag Proposal Thread in [/forum/c-51015/proposals-and-policy this forum], and should be added to this guide if approved, ideally with three example images. New art tags should be applicable to at least 25 different pages (including artist, artwork, or comic pages), and should meet the following criteria:

* Objective, two different readers should generally agree on which artwork tags to apply.
* Accessible, people with minimal artistic training should be able to understand and apply every tag.
* Navigationally useful, people should actually want to search for the tag.

+ Pages Featuring Original Art

++ Artist and Artwork pages

**[/system:page-tags/tag/artwork artwork]** - artwork pages host Foundation-related artwork created by community members, whether as individual pieces or collections.

**[/system:page-tags/tag/artist artist]** - This tag should be used for artist profile pages. If a site member wants more than one artist profile page, they must get staff permission first.

The primary use for art tags is on pages specifically created to display artwork. It is up to artists whether to post each individual work on its own artwork page, or to post multiple works on the same artwork page. Artist pages can be created to showcase an artist's entire portfolio, but are often used as a hub for the artist's other works, which may be posted on separate artwork pages.

++ Comics

**[/system:page-tags/tag/comic comic]** - For stories that are primarily told via sequential art.

This tag can be applied to tales as well as to artwork pages, as the decision of whether to classify comics as artworks or tales is left up to the individual writer/artist. In the absence of other information, it usually comes down to whether or not the page is posted in the art: category. Comics are eligible for art tags, regardless of whether or not they are posted as tales or as artwork.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/c7a6d690-d419-41f6-89ed-d3cb3ca04962/dg9bbey-bbab8ba8-993e-4f76-b1e5-3753039adc69.png/v1/fit/w_750,h_1126,q_70,strp/act_1_cover___scp_001__last_ride_of_the_day_by_artwithcharley_dg9bbey-375w-2x.jpg?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..YrqoLHxh1l2NCyR8jOVbrI5_dVrfSu_mr4OdA2R-BU4 link="/art:lrotd-act1" style="height:200px;"]]
[[image https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/c7a6d690-d419-41f6-89ed-d3cb3ca04962/dg9bblx-27dad0a7-db54-4d66-b569-943f8e43c6e7.png/v1/fit/w_750,h_1126/act_1_page_1___scp_001__last_ride_of_the_day_by_artwithcharley_dg9bblx-375w-2x.png?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..uKf9n5_TxlyTlJftktqTPNr3tGDudGQerUeG_0e_hPQ link="/art:lrotd-act1" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:lrotd-act1 | "Last Ride of the Day"]]], a comic adaption by [[user Reasonably Psychotic]] of [[[dyfscp-001 | D. Ulysses Foole's Proposal]]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art:mynamejers-artwork-pile/Take_Only_Two_PG_1.png link="/art:mynamejers-artwork-pile" style="height:200px;"]]
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art:mynamejers-artwork-pile/Take_Only_Two_PG_2.png link="/art:mynamejers-artwork-pile" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:mynamejers-artwork-pile | "Two and A Half Anomalies"]]], a series of comics by [[user MyNameJers]] featuring [[[SCP-682]]], [[[SCP-079]]] and [[[SCP-053]]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/4aa2b0bf-5a03-412f-9c8c-dec951f4b9ff/dfmpza5-a72da487-f4ff-45b9-9bf0-fda3c596d7e0.jpg/v1/fill/w_723,h_1105,q_70,strp/dbc3ca33_bf85_478e_8d89_9491a4b2e627_by_drasknes44376_dfmpza5-pre.jpg?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..jru_BfrQMyvPBhVLlxo_iR6BfLy8rgK-twf5KCfXNmQ link="/art:minus-a-seed-of-anew-eve-manga" style="height:200px;"]]
[[image https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/4aa2b0bf-5a03-412f-9c8c-dec951f4b9ff/dfmpzai-656643cb-c177-4166-b8e4-04b493be9ee2.jpg/v1/fill/w_723,h_1105,q_70,strp/16d47178_8f1e_44c3_80e5_4b7ceb9e17b5_by_drasknes44376_dfmpzai-pre.jpg?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..esd6zKmM1wfbxu-cgRkkDQBrgvFDPNWivtP6WSIxooU link="/art:minus-a-seed-of-anew-eve-manga" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:minus-a-seed-of-anew-eve-manga | "Minus A seed Of Anew Eve"]]], an original manga by [[user John Asknes]] inspired by [[[sarkicism-hub | Sarkicism]]].
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Illustrated Articles

**[/system:page-tags/tag/illustrated illustrated]** - Article has an illustration specifically created for the article, including photobashes and other forms of photo manipulation.

This tag is applicable to all other pages featuring original artwork, including SCP articles, tales, GoI formats, hubs, resources and author pages. This tag should only be applied if the art was created for the article, and not to artworks found elsewhere, although it's fine if the art was initially posted off-site before the artist chose to use it as an illustration on the SCP Wiki.

This includes art created by the author or by one of their collaborators, as well as art they commission for the article. It does apply to photoshopping images, although only if it goes beyond simple edits - see the section below on the image-editing tag for more information. It also includes logos, but only if they were created for that article - subsequent uses of the same artwork elsewhere shouldn't count for this tag.

Since there are so many articles illustrated in some way, the application of this tag is currently incomplete. If you notice it is missing on an older article and are confident it applies, feel free to add it.

Illustrated pages are not eligible for Art Style and Art Content tags.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art"]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-7785/LengthwiseLongwaysfull.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-7785" style="height:200px;"]] 
[[[SCP-7785]]] - Mr. Lengthwise and Mr. Longways, written and illustrated by [[user PeppersGhost]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/kIUysFL.jpeg link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/nightnotomorrow
" style="height:200px;"]] 
Meri and Iris from [[[nightnotomorrow| A Night With No Tomorrow]]], illustrated by [[user sailorenoch]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art"]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/gamers-against-weed-hub/harder-better-faster-gamer.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/gamers-against-weed-hub" style="height:200px;"]] 
The [[[gamers-against-weed-hub| Gamers Against Weed Hub]]], illustrated by [[user daveyoufool]].
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

+ Style Tags

The following tags are some of the most common and recognisable art styles we see on the SCP Wiki. It's possible that more than one of these tags may apply to a page, since there may be multiple pieces using different styles on the same page, or even individual artworks using multiple art styles in the same piece. It's also possible that none of these tags are an appropriate descriptor of the artwork, in which case you can simply not apply any of them.

++ Animated Art

**[/system:page-tags/tag/animated animated]** - artwork is animated. Generally applies to .gif files. Superceded by [/system:page-tags/tag/interactive interactive] and [/system:page-tags/tag/video video].

We have separate tags for interactive games and videos embedded within the page, so this should only be applied to simple animated loops like the ones shown below. These are usually .gif files, although this tag would also apply to other file formats such as [[[svg-animation | .svg animations]]].

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/artist-showcase-archive/Ironshears-tattletale.gif link="/art:art-mycotherapy-2774-pix" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:art-mycotherapy | Animated pixel art]]] by [[user IronShears]], depicting [[[SCP-2744]]] - TATTLETALE. 
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/1IfEVyL.gif link="/art:holiday-exchange-gold" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:holiday-exchange-gold | Animated artwork]]] by [[user Dino--Draws]], depicting Hedvig Nussbaum from [[[rounderhouse-gold-proposal | ROUNDERHOUSE's Gold Proposal]]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/bef5fe99-9fa1-4487-9414-032c9d3f0657/dgjz5mk-bb876ca5-1f86-48f2-a84c-5ab0145e411a.gif?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..uwsEu_n1rYIvrIbbPHMdnjj3fVaUT2TcJsSbwQDcrJ8 link="/art:shark-punching-fun" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:shark-punching-fun | Animated artwork]]] by [[user  Gelbsucht_IE]], depicting the [[[groups-of-interest#shark-punching-center | Shark Punching Centre]]] in action!
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Cel-Shaded Art
**[/system:page-tags/tag/cel-shaded cel-shaded]** - artwork with outlines drawn, then shaded using solid blocks of color or gradients. The characteristic style of animation, comic books and manga. 

While off the wiki this term is mostly used to describe digital animation mimicking traditional methods, we would apply the same tag to work that is physically drawn and inked. The distinctive characteristic of this style is having clearly distinct blocks of color, although there may be some shading or gradients.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/FuDU5Cb.png link="/2-rhine-2-river" style="height:150px;"]]
[[[2-rhine-2-river | Artwork]]] by [[user Rhineriver]], depicting [[[SCP-5366]]] - Until Death Do Us Part And Every Day After.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/4eec5159-a60c-4609-9648-95233048a0a2/desoepg-52d6ea7a-704d-4953-b70e-a74f64fd3bae.png/v1/fill/w_2224,h_1528,q_80,strp/scp__halloween_on_17th_street_by_zal_cryptid_desoepg-fullview.jpg?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..cVCpk2pA-tV_ZTv9HItzklzVYDTHD-1SDbTHkL13bxQ link="/zal-cryptid-s-artwork-hub" style="height:150px;"]]
[[[zal-cryptid-s-artwork-hub |Artwork]]] by [[user Zal Cryptid]], depicting the tale [[[Halloween on 17th Street]]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://66.media.tumblr.com/e5ca8ea44ba7e7a900b249eaa1173016/c34114e3274ab5d2-3a/s640x960/695268bd05af10a98cdc3e494e8aa059b91685c0.jpg link="/hibikikn-s-artwork-page" style="height:150px;"]]
[[[hibikikn-s-artwork-page |  Artwork]]] by [[user Hibikikn]], depicting [[[SCP-076]]] - "Able".
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Image Editing

**[/system:page-tags/tag/image-editing image-editing]** - artwork created by altering or combining existing images.

This is for artwork created through image editing - photoshopping images is a common example, but it also applies to collages created from multiple sources, and to vector graphics based on existing assets. It doesn't apply to basic techniques like cropping, or to digital artwork originally created by the artist and edited as part of their process. Any images used should be compliant with our site license (CC BY-SA 3.0.), and the artwork should be accompanied by information about the source of the images used - see our [[[Image Use Policy]]] for more information about this. 

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--resized-images/valdevia/6k-Rounderhouse/medium.jpg link="/valdevia" style="height:150px;"]]
[[[valdevia | Photobash]]] by [[user Valdevia]], depicting [[[SCP-6000]]] - The Serpent, the Moose, and the Wanderer's Library.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/jINrTz9.jpg link="/artyurt" style="height:150px;"]]
[[[artyurt| Postcard]]] by [[user ROUNDERHOUSE]], depicting [[[SCP-7005]]] - The Neon God.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/dodos-7kollages/Rose-m.jpg link="/dodos-7kollages" style="height:150px;"]]
[[[dodos-7kollages| Collage]]] by [[user DodoDevil]], depicting [[[SCP-7008]]] - A Single Plastic Rose.
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Painted Art

**[/system:page-tags/tag/painted painted]** - artwork created using paint or pastel, or using digital brush strokes to blend colors and mimic the appearance of paint.

For this tag the appearance matters more than the actual medium used to create the piece. Artwork should get this tag if there's deliberate blending of colours, in contrast to the distinct blocks of color seen in cel-shaded art. Both tags may apply to the same artwork, for example if cel-shaded characters are placed in front of a painted background.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/duy-giang-s-artworks/mtf_pi_1___city_slickers_v1__by_duygiang1207 link="https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/duy-giang-s-artworks/mtf_pi_1___city_slickers_v1__by_duygiang1207" style="height:250px;"]]
[[[duy-giang-s-artworks| Artwork]]] by [[user Duy Giang]], depicting [[[task-forces#pi-1 | Mobile Task Force Pi-1]]] - "City Slickers".
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art:red-reality-painting/redreality.png link="/art:red-reality-painting" style="height:250px;"]]
[[[art:red-reality-painting| A painting]]] by [[user EmotionalEntropy]], depicting [[[SCP-3001]]] - Red Reality.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image http://olicus.wikidot.com/local--files/2022/beneath-two-trees.PNG link="/olicus-art" style="height:250px;"]]
[[[olicus-art| Artwork]]] by [[user Olicus]], depicting the tale [[[Beneath Two Trees]]].
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Pixel Art

**[/system:page-tags/tag/pixel-art pixel-art]** - artwork created by drawing individual pixels, or by deliberately pixelating an existing image.

This should be easy to recognise, as the defining feature of pixel art is that you're meant to be able to see the individual pixels.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/crystlon/SCP0035.png link="/crystlon" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[/crystlon | Pixel Art]]] by [[user Crystlon]], depicting [[[SCP-035]]] - The Possessive Mask.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/JxNIdpr.png link="/envipixel-artpage" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[envipixel-artpage | Pixel Art]]] by [[user Envi_Pixel]], depicting [[[SCP-7179]]] - E is for Eternity.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art:darkartists-muddy-skies-art/muddy-skies.png link="/art:darkartists-muddy-skies-art" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:darkartists-muddy-skies-art | Pixel Art]]] by [[user TheDarkArtist]], depicting the Parawatch Tale [[[Muddy Skies]]].
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Sketched Art

**[/system:page-tags/tag/sketched sketched]** - artwork drawn with pencil, pen or crayon, or created digitally in a similar style. May be shaded, or left as a line drawing.

This tag is intended for stylised and simple drawings, generally without much color. This is mostly for freehand pencil sketches, but also applies to simple digital lineart, as shown below.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/aANcIa4.jpg link="/la-cadente-cantina-di-cave" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[la-cadente-cantina-di-cave |  Drawing]]] by [[user just cave]], depicting [[[SCP-085]]] - Hand-drawn ''Cassy''.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/art:crackhead-173-fanart/Crackhead.jpg link="/art:crackhead-173-fanart" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[winkwonk-doodles | A doodle]]] by [[user Winkwonkboi]], depicting [[[SCP-173]]] - The Sculpture. 
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/scp-silly-doodles/1157.png link="/scp-silly-doodles" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[scp-silly-doodles |  Lineart]]] by [[user Raddagher]], depicting [[[SCP-1157]]] - Bifurcating Man.
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

+ Content Tags

The following tags describe what the artwork depicts, in very general terms. More than one of these tags may apply to an individual artwork, or to different artworks on the same page.

++ Logos

**[/system:page-tags/tag/logo logo]** - artwork depicts one or more logos or other symbolic graphics, such as insignia, flags and coats of arms.

This is for artwork that represents something, somewhere or someone. Usually these are created through vector graphics, but the tag would also apply to logos created by hand.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/4uLBoQ3.png link="/desk-of-junior-designer-s-yvonne" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[desk-of-junior-designer-s-yvonne | Department Logo]]] by [[user EstrellaYoshte]], for the Foundation's [[[departments#raisa | RAISA Department]]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image http://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/secure-facilities-locations/Site-184.svg link="/art:secure-facilities-locations" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:secure-facilities-locations | Foundation Facility Insignia]]] by [[user Jerden]], depicting the logo of [[[secure-facility-dossier-site-184| Site-184]]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/art:049-but-logos/049_but_AWCY.svg link="/art:049-but-logos" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:049-but-logos | Are We Cured Yet?]]] by [[user Dr Hormress]], reimagining [[[SCP-049]]] as a member of [[[are-we-cool-yet-hub | Are We Cool Yet?]]]. 
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Posters

**[/system:page-tags/tag/poster poster]** - artwork depicts a poster, infographic or advertisment, using a combination of images and words to convey information.

If the artist doesn't specifically describe something as a poster, then this tag should only be added if that's the obvious intention of the artwork.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://imgur.com/ciUEu5P.png link="art:thatartpageofalltime" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:thatartpageofalltime | Poster]]] by [[user ThatGuyThatTime]], depicting [[[SCP-4008]]] - Wormwood.
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/grigori-karpin-s-author-page/movieposter2 link="/the-art-of-vikander-kneed-technical-media" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[the-art-of-vikander-kneed-technical-media | Movie poster]]] from [[[SCP-5479]]] - A Movie of You, by [[user Grigori Karpin]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/art%3Aremember-to-stalk/STALK link="/art:remember-to-stalk" style="height:200px;"]]
[[[art:remember-to-stalk | Poster]]] by [[user BattleblockB0ss]], based on [[[SCP-6470]]] - Omnipresent. 
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ Group of Interest (GoI) Art

**[/system:page-tags/tag/goi-art goi-art]** - artwork depicting characters, objects, or themes from a specific Group of Interest. Also applies to GoI logos.

If an art page focuses on a specific GoI, it should also be tagged with the appropriate [[[/groups-of-interest | Group of Interest]]] tag. There's also a section of the [https://05command.wikidot.com/tech-hub-tag-list Character Tag list] for Persons of Interest associated with specific GoIs, who may also appear in goi-art.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/ec13709a-43f2-4b25-9089-5967ff8b5874/df4mkw1-9ba084e8-3bed-4f67-850d-0f8aa8cae421.jpg?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..6a7rcJelY0u_fKYg73kDa9k89TdUiLLDQBM5MXv_aJk link="/sunny-art-goi" style="height:250px;"]]
A [[[sunny-art-goi | GoI Artwork]]] depicting [[[fifthist-hub | Fifthism]]], by [[user SunnyClockwork]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/art:chaz-ambrose-serving-baklava/chaz-ambrose-serving-baklava.jpg link="/art:chaz-ambrose-serving-baklava" style="height:250px;"]]
[[[art:chaz-ambrose-serving-baklava| Chaz Ambrose Serving Baklava]]] by [[user PiNKpePpER]], depicting the founder of [[[ambrose-restaurant-hub | Ambrose Restaurants]]].
[[/div]]

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/2Haagyr.png link="/niram-art" style="height:250px;"]]
[[[niram-art | "Ion Ascendant"]]] by [[user niram]], depicting the founder of [[[sarkicism-hub | Sarkicism]]]. 
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

++ SCP Foundation Personnel Art

**[/system:page-tags/tag/personnel-art personnel-art]** - artwork depicting specific SCP Foundation employees. 

While this is often for art depicting doctors and researchers, the tag also applies to depictions of other site staff and field agents, as well as directors and O5 Command.

While artwork depicting well-known characters like Doctor Alto Clef is an obvious use for this tag, it is applicable to any art focusing on the people that work for the Foundation, including original characters created by the artist. [https://05command.wikidot.com/tech-hub-tag-list Check the list of character tags] for Foundation Personnel with their own character tags, which can be applied to artwork in addition to the personnel-art tag.

[[div class="art-container"]]  

[[div class="art" ]]  
[[image https://i.imgur.com/tbz5X7d.jpg link="/art:placeholder-fanart" style="height:180px;"]]

[[[portraits-of-site-58 | Portrait]]] by [[user OriTiefling]], depicting Agent Basil Silas from the artist's [[[scp-5828 | own]]] [[[scp-6033 | SCP]]] [[[scp-7999 | articles]]].

[[/div]]

++ SCP Object Art

**[/system:page-tags/tag/scp-art scp-art]** - artwork depicting one or more SCP objects or entities.

This is the SCP Wiki, so obviously we get a lot of this! Famous SCPs like [[[SCP-173]]], [[[SCP-682]]], and [[[SCP-049]]] get the most attention, and artwork depicting them can also be given their specific character tags - there's a section of the [https://05command.wikidot.com/tech-hub-tag-list Character tag list] that contains all SCP objects with their own character tags. However, the scp-art tag can be applied to any illustration of an SCP, including SCPs that are inanimate objects, locations or events.
